p: In vivo tests of the aqueous extract of E. myriochaetum showed an inhibitory effect on the production of hepatic glucose at 120 min with 324 mg/dL during the pyruvate tolerance test when using metformin as a hypoglycemic control [ 14]. This evidence suggests the biological potential hypoglycemia of these species as a whole; however, E. myriochaetum has been hardly studied as a reservoir of additional bioactive chemical compounds, such as antiproliferative agents, even when some related Equisetum species showed this potential [ 15, 16].
